What do you love about this place?: Food is absolutely fantastic
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Kimchi Fried Rice

What do you love about this place?: Rotating menus that highlight the best of the current season. Don't go just for pizza - the salads, pastas, entrees, and especially dessers are where Pizzaiolo truly shines. Almost everything is cooked in their wood-fired pizza oven (hence the name, which in Italian means "in the style of pizza"). Their breakfast offerings are also remarkable!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The menu changes frequently so nothing is guaranteed, but I've had no bad dishes here. Some particular highlights include their meatballs, fried chicken, persimmon and fennel salad, pork coppa, pepperoni and jalape√±o pizza, and ricotta donuts (particularly with their housemade almond and fig gelato during the summertime). For breakfast, I recommend the savory porridge or biscuits and gravy.
How far in advance do we need to plan?: All tables are walk-in only but check their website beforehand because they sometimes take limited reservations for holidays or will be closed to host weddings or other private events. In the summer, patio seating fills up quickly after opening.

What do you love about this place?: Cheesy name but best burritos in town. Recommend carne asada
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Carne asada burrito

What do you love about this place?: The superstar shrimp and Burmese style lamb curry are truly like having a bite from my Malaysian grandmother‚Äôs kitchen. Super authentic southeast Asian taste, mashing together Malay, Thai, Singapore, and Chinese cuisine in an epic menu!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Superstar shrimp, Burmese style lamb curry, roti platha, tea leaf salad, spicy and crispy chicken, vegetable samosa
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Go on the earlier side during a week day to get a spot! The service is fast but always a popular spot

What do you love about this place?: Everything is sharable and delicious. Fantastic mocktails. Reservations are not impossible
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Fried Chicken, Crab Fried Rice, Grilled Beef Skewer, Baby Gem Salad, Crispy Lamb Ribs, Snapper
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Two days to be safe but highly variable

What do you love about this place?: Coming from a SoCal snob, this is the best Mexican food in the Bay Area. Super flavorful and elevated in just the right way. The vibe is awesome too - built into an old fire station with high ceilings and lots of indoor and outdoor seating.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Spicy carrots, trout tostadas, quesadilla with braised pork, grilled swordfish, carne asada huarache
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Peak dinner time reservations book out a few days in advance. Same-day availability is usually possible, but recommend booking a week in advance.

What do you love about this place?: These are my favorite dumplings I've ever had in a restaurant, and the closest to tasting like my mom's home cooked dumplings. It is no frills, all dumplings are handmade, and the price is super reasonable.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Napa cabbage and pork is the OG dumpling type! If you don't eat red meat, the chicken is a good alternative.
How far in advance do we need to plan?: First come first serve, but it's not usually too long of a wait, though maybe 15-30 minutes tops.

What do you love about this place?: I‚Äôm a native Brazilian, and I can honestly say this is truly authentic, homemade Brazilian food. It‚Äôs the kind of meal that tastes like something your grandma would make, if your grandma were Brazilian. Every time I eat there, it feels like my mom cooked the meal for me. It genuinely feels like home. If you want to experience what Brazilian food is like when it‚Äôs made by Brazilians, this is the place. On top of that, the owner is incredibly friendly and treats you like family.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Feijoada
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Just show up. It‚Äôs pretty cheap too. Cheaper than normal Brazilian places

What do you love about this place?: Heirloom Caf√© is one of those places that feels instantly comforting and effortlessly special. Deeply rooted in its neighborhood, it offers a seasonal menu that evolves throughout the year, showcasing creative, beautifully executed dishes. Pair that with a fantastic wine selection, and you have a restaurant that delivers every single time. A true local favorite that never disappoints.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The menu is always changing, and it never disappoints.

What do you love about this place?: Really great dry pot and good drinks
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Dry pot! Must have lotus root

What do you love about this place?: This is a no-frills sports bar that just has all around good pub food but the thing to get here is the chicken tenders. These puppies come with barbecue sauce and ranch included (like you don‚Äôt even have to ask for it!!) and a killer side of fries. Basic I know, but this is a great happy hour spot to grab some thing to eat after our workout class at core power or before you hit Motown Monday at Madrones. Salty and good- they usually have booths open and the same locals at the bar everyday.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Chicky Tendies

What do you love about this place?: Reminds me of New Orleans
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Shrimp and grits

What do you love about this place?: Staff and aesthetic. Also good seating in the back on a nice day.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Start with the MEZZA SAMPLER and order more of what you want after.

What do you love about this place?: Amazing Vietnamese/Taiwanese fusion chicken spot. Locally owned - you can often catch the owner working the register and he's very friendly. Fast service. Perfect place to stop in for a quick bite while strolling down Valencia St.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Peppercorn wings, five spice chicken, charbroiled beef, with garlic noodles or vermicelli rather than ph·ªü here

What do you love about this place?: Food and prices ‚Äî lots of vegetarian options
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Anything vegetarian. I literally order something different every time I am there.

What do you love about this place?: In a quiet neighborhood in the Marina. Easy to make a reservation. Small business and very authentic. The staff is French and try to greet you by name. Their food is amazing and prices are reasonable.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Grilled Chicken Sandwich

What do you love about this place?: Food is incredible and it‚Äôs a family run spot with some of the most friendly servers!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Triple C cauliflower, Wings, or Tofu is the best thing on their menu

What do you love about this place?: Family owned business, Rami and his grandma are generally working the front and make for such a fun, bustling, sub shop vibe. Cash only
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Hot Pastrami Sub with 'the works'!

What do you love about this place?: Creamiest, most tasty gelato in SF. No questions.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Pistachio gialto and the gianduia crunch

What do you love about this place?: Great pizza and Detroit style beer. Crispy cheese and great bread for the pizza.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Red Top

What do you love about this place?: Great vibes, even better food
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Fried squash bottom (seasonal)
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Walk in only, wait is probably around 1 hour so yelp waitlist and go do something else

What do you love about this place?: Food is great, ran by a super cute couple, small intimate setting
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Set menu
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Very hard reservation to get, and book 1 month out. Very $$$$

What do you love about this place?: Great, affordable Thai food. They serve Khao Soi (my favorite Thai dish) which many Thai restaurants don‚Äôt offer as it‚Äôs a specialty from northern Thailand.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Khao Soi, Pad Kee Mao, Fried Spring Rolls

What do you love about this place?: The name says it all
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: I always get #13 curry chicken noodle soup & spring rolls

What do you love about this place?: Neapolitan pizza, cocktails, back patio, everything is homemade in house
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Meatballs, pepperoni pizza, acapulco pizza, burrata appetizer
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Would recommend a couple days for reservation. Walkin sometimes works for bar but expect to wait an hour

What do you love about this place?: Has been here over 10 years and my Mexican parents approve of it and the drinks are great. It‚Äôs neighborhoody / datey / perfect for any occasion.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Chilaquiles verdes, don pepino, special desserts ü§§ü§§
Reservation needed/required?: Can get crowded but usually I walk in for ~4 or less.

What do you love about this place?: It‚Äôs delicious. It‚Äôs Palestinian-owned. They do things with garlic that will make you question everything. What more do you need?
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Falafel. üßÜ

What do you love about this place?: It‚Äôs cheaper than the Mission, you can sit by the lake and eat it, and it‚Äôs delicious.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Get a burrito! Get all the salsas!

What do you love about this place?: It‚Äôs Black-owned, it‚Äôs dessert, and it‚Äôs delicious
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Key lime pie or any citrus tart/pie

What do you love about this place?: It‚Äôs so classy and tasteful without trying too hard. The space is refined, cozy, and a little romantic, with a partially open kitchen and copper pots everywhere. The pastas are handmade and always incredible‚ÄîI‚Äôve genuinely never had a bad dish here. The wine list is amazing, with a lot of really thoughtful, niche bottles, and the service is impeccable. Hyper-local ingredients, Italian technique. I‚Äôd bring someone here if they really love food, or if I wanted to impress a date in a subtle way.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Raviolo, gnocco fritto is a comfort classic. The menu rotates a lot, but those two are often on it. Great seasonal salads.
Reservation needed/required?: Reservations are hard to get. I‚Äôve always walked in, and often will sit at the bar. The waitlist is usually long but they often get you in faster than they say they will.
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Often are booked a month out.

What do you love about this place?: Best spicy coleslaw I‚Äôve ever had. Simple: all you can order is a fried chicken sandwich or salad. The pro move is to get it to go and walk across the street to Kingfish, a perfect dive bar, and eat your lunch on the back patio while watching a Warriors game.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Salad all the way!

What do you love about this place?: Low key taco truck with amaaazing food. I always take friends that visit to this spot and it‚Äôs one of those places that you take your first bite and forget where you‚Äôre at. Eventually you look up and realize no one has been talking because they‚Äôre all lost in the sauce of the food experience
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Sope al pastor and torta de milanesa. If you‚Äôve never had a sope, this is the place to convert. I‚Äôve never had a torta on a ciabatta bread before this but - I see the vision

What do you love about this place?: Skip the fancy lattes here and go straight to all the desserts. You can‚Äôt leave without trying their soft baked cookies - they are the best!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: All the soft baked cookies!

What do you love about this place?: Very casual and off the side of the road - food made and served from a historic train caboose. Chef is ex Michelan and the food is amazing!!!!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Don‚Äôt miss out on the mushroom sandwich and Mac n cheese
Reservation needed/required?: Food served till they run out so plan to go early
How far in advance do we need to plan?: No reservation but just don‚Äôt plan to show up close to when they shut down as they will run out of food!

What do you love about this place?: Staff is amazing, space is funky and fun, food is great! "Mr Pollo offers a 4 course tasting menu that changes often. We source from local farmers and have a beer and wine list to match our food. Reservations are a must as there are only 12 seats and fill up quickly.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Set menu
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Depends on the day, 1 week to 1 month ish

What do you love about this place?: Absolute hole in the wall with the best Chinese food in San Francisco, unbelievable sauces and flavors, super affordable, right off the L train, and everyone we bring here becomes as obsessed as us. If we could only eat at one restaurant in the city for the rest of our lives, this would be it.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Shanghai soup dumplings, spicy green beans, Dan Dan noodles, spicy wontons. It‚Äôs a perfect order. Don‚Äôt reduce, only add to it!

What do you love about this place?: Old school Italian af! Waitstaff will occasionally bring you food they‚Äôre just working on in the kitchen, the martinis are crisp, the ambiance is next level Goodfellas, and the food MY GOD the food! The most tender osso bucco on the planet!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The osso bucco, a dirty martini, any vodka based pasta

What do you love about this place?: Super local spot with live music every night! It‚Äôs an interesting of white table cloth Italian/dive bar. Affordable pricing on solid pasta dishes and super friendly bartenders. You‚Äôll definitely hear some stories about old SF.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Popcorn Chicken happy meal, Brussels sprouts and the meatballs!
How far in advance do we need to plan?: No need, just get there a bit before the show starts before all the locals take the good tables!

Restaurant Name: Chris & Sons Roti Shop and Bakery
What do you love about this place?: Good local spot for Caribbean eats (curry, roti, trini pastries, etc.).
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Curry chicken roti

What do you love about this place?: Best vegan food in the city, super creative and tasty, nicest chefs, under the radar.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The menu changes but if they have the crab cakes or hibiscus tacos, absolutely get both.

What do you love about this place?: Specialty grocer/bottle shop that also sells delicious tacos/tortas with counter seating
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Best carnitas in SF; mushroom taco
How far in advance do we need to plan?: N/A but tortas sell out early

What do you love about this place?: I love the hilarious owner, regulars, rowdy and welcoming in a teeny tiny space. Old school SF
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Alcohol in a brown paper bag

What do you love about this place?: Hands down best chips/salsa and tequila selection in the city. Family owned for over 50 years and original Tommy‚Äôs Margarita. Great vibe. If you‚Äôre feeling tough try their spicy tequila challenge, but be warned now it‚Äôs üî•üî•
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Chips and salsa. Tommy‚Äôs Marg. Yucat√°n Tamale

What do you love about this place?: It‚Äôs a great mix of traditional and modern takes on Persian food - accessible to the yts and non Persians, and ~* trendy enough to entice folks to try something new
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Kashke Bademjan , masto musir for apps. Kabob koobideh and the lamb ribs for entrees. Try ghormeh sabzi too and don‚Äôt forget to ask for the tadig (crispy rice) in case they have any available !
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Literally weeks for prime reservation slots  - put on resy notifications!

What do you love about this place?: Amazing for groups, fantastic Peruvian food (ceviche, empanadas,) also rotisserie chicken and truffle mac. Super quick and great service every time!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Sangria, half chicken, truffle Mac & cheese, ceviche

What do you love about this place?: Amazinggg Pho! Cute vibe, worth the Tenderloin trip!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Beef or chicken pho is delicious!
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Expect to wait 15 min or so if you go at a busy time (aka a weekend meal time)

What do you love about this place?: Right near Golden Gate Park, great bar/pub. But HAVE to get the buffalo wings.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Buffalo wings, best in SF!

What do you love about this place?: This place brought me out of Oregon seasonal depressive disorder in the depths of PWN winter. I used to drive 2 hours for this ramen in college. Great location and cute shopping around it too.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The tan tan broth with pork helped my frontal lobe fully develop. Honorable mention for the Japanese tacos.

What do you love about this place?: Tons of variations on a classic dish everyone loves.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Gilroy Garlic Mac

What do you love about this place?: The food is so authentic and hasn‚Äôt charged the last 10 years. Family owned and operated.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Quanta Firfir
Beef ribs,

What do you love about this place?: Incredible chicken. Truly some of my favorite in the world.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: 1/2 chicken with rice and beans

What do you love about this place?: Small, hole in the wall Japanese place in the Castro that is cozy and inviting!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The sushi is fine but the homemade tofu is TO DIE FOR -- I feel that their main dishes that aren't sushi are the realm winners.

What do you love about this place?: The people that run this truck are so kind and the tacos are the best in the city.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Carnitas and carne asada tacos are always winners.
How far in advance do we need to plan?: The truck sets up at 23rd and Treat M-F until 5pm and can be a bit elusive.

What do you love about this place?: Gus' is a local market with spots around the city, but they have really good sandwiches if you're looking for something quick!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The 1906 sandwich on Dutch Crunch is something I dream about. DO NOT ORDER FROM THE HAIGHT LOCATION -- something ain't right there wrt the sandos.

What do you love about this place?: Hole in the wall, but the pho is amazing and it's open for breakfast if you're into that!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Ph·ªü T√°i or Ph·ªü T√°i n·∫°m

What do you love about this place?: Great deli in the Castro with super funny people running the counter who WILL JUDGE YOU IF YOU DO NOT ORDER SPICY.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Falafel deluxe sandwich SPICY -- they WILL judge you openly if you do not get it spicy (it's not too hot).

What do you love about this place?: Super small, but quick with the orders. Everything is vegan, but you wouldn't guess it.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: No shirt no shoes or half nekked burrito

What do you love about this place?: The food- according to my bf ‚Äúorder anything and it‚Äôs going to be great‚Äù
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: We get the vegan options (the ‚Äúnosh‚Äù size is filling but go for the ‚Äúmajor munch‚Äù if you‚Äôre hungry) his order- mac and cheese, breadcrumbs, garlic and beef; her order: mac and cheese, extra breadcrumbs, parsley, rosemary and garlic

What do you love about this place?: THE FOOD IS SO GOOD
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Wheat Empanadas - Viagra, Brasil; Corn Empanada - Portobello; LENTIL SOUP WITH AVOCADO. GREEN SAUCE IS A REQUIREMENT FOR THE EMPANADAS!! The churros are great too if you have space. We usually get a few of each empanada

What do you love about this place?: This is the best al pastor I have had in my life as a Mexican American who has been to Mexico many times and lived in both the bay and LA. You will wait over 20 min for food, it‚Äôs on a street with nothing but warehouses but it‚Äôs so worth it. There are always people there and it‚Äôs amazing to buy a beer and wait at a table or hell, just in your car or on the curb for this food. I wish it were nearer so I could go every week.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: AL PASTOR

What do you love about this place?: You‚Äôre in FiDi or Embarcadero, you need something yummy, not fancy but still a good atomosphere and proper service. It‚Äôs like Goldilocks‚Äô porridge, hard to find something that fits all of these boxes but OSHA is IT. Plus it‚Äôs delicious Thai in a city that needs more delicious Thai.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Pumpkin curry, pad Thai sunrise, all the appetizers, fresh coconut
How far in advance do we need to plan?: No planning which is part of why it‚Äôs awesome

What do you love about this place?: Vibes are immaculate. Wine list is sensational. Menu is unique and well executed.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Off-menu burger and the duck.

What do you love about this place?: The food is great and the owner Antonio is so friendly and welcoming, he always has great suggestions and tells you all about where he‚Äôs sourced ingredients. Great for a full dinner or afternoon glass of wine at the bar, you‚Äôll usually get a few snacks thrown in.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The pasta and apps never miss

What do you love about this place?: The coziest little restaurant, everyone is so friendly and the sushi is delightful and very well priced for the quality.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Nigiri
How far in advance do we need to plan?: If there‚Äôs two of you you can pretty much always walk in. Make a res for bigger groups.

What do you love about this place?: Incredible food and cocktails! Great for small group dinners and they have a big back room for private events.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Kale Chaat!

What do you love about this place?: Great vibes for a casual hang with friends. Order a bottle of wine, tapas, and hang out for a while. Often has live music too.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Try a vermouth! Also can‚Äôt go wrong with some Jamon and Pan con Tomate

What do you love about this place?: The sauces are world-class, the sangria is glorious. The decor is gaudy and unique.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Cajun shrimp, Chicken Pillard, warm spinach salad, plantains

What do you love about this place?: Wellllll - I went here hundred times and it was choice
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Honsestly don‚Äôt remember - but the lady who owns this will sort you

What do you love about this place?: Handmade, SUPER fresh dumplings. Small menu with all items elite. Also they sell most of dumplings frozen to go so you can cook them later
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The classic pork dumpling

What do you love about this place?: Highly suggest if you want comfort food paired with a good wine selection. The open space kitchen and high ceiling layout makes me feel like I‚Äôm visiting a family cabin, with meals coming straight out of a wood fired oven
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Focaccia w/ whipped mascarpone, Polpo (octopus), Pizza: Amatriciana and Zucca (they also have pineapple pizza), Lasagna, Angelo Arosto (lamb)

What do you love about this place?: Mochi donuts. This is my stop when I want something sweet and comforting after a long week. Bonus points to the staff who has given me free donuts in the past.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: The black sesame mochi donut and the matcha latte

What do you love about this place?: The flavorful and strong cocktails, the dark and sexy ambience, and the great playlist. I suggest this spot for catching up with a friend or for date night.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Get the ‚ÄúMango Daddy‚Äù cocktail if you like ginger and citrus forward cocktails‚Äîthis one is Smokey because of mezcal. Save room for the tikka masala flatbread.

What do you love about this place?: The flavor, spice, and portion sizes. Great place to go when you‚Äôre really hungry or after getting drinks in the mission.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Saag paneer, chicken biryani, and chicken tikka masala

What do you love about this place?: DUMPLINGS!!!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Any dumplings. And beef noodle soup

What do you love about this place?: FOOD! Very much a local spot, no frills. Incredible food. Cannot stress enough.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Xian cold noodles are an absolute must order.

What do you love about this place?: This is the go to neighborhood spot that your new girlfriend, mom, and rowdy best friend will love! The combinations shouldn‚Äôt make sense- deep broth ramen and charred octapus on the same menu is a lot. But like the melting pot that is Ditmas Park/ Flatbush, this restaurant recognizes that one thing unites us all- flavor! Everything hits in your mouth and wants you to take that second bite. Also the drinks are neighborhood level strong.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Chorizo, sangria, ramen

What do you love about this place?: I‚Äôve lived in San Francisco my entire life aside from college and I‚Äôve been getting the burritos here the entire time. It‚Äôs a sleeper because people think if it‚Äôs on Valencia, it must be a yuppie location, but I‚Äôll be honest. They have the softest flower tortillas, the ratios of ingredients are insane, they crisp up the Carnitas like no one else, I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. And if the two sauces they have on offer aren‚Äôt spicy enough for your liking, ask for the ‚Äútaco Salsa‚Äú
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Carnitas burrito

What do you love about this place?: Unassuming corner store with amazing gourmet sandwiches, pastries, and prepared food, and super nice staff
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Call Me Serge

What do you love about this place?: Lunch-only food truck probably has the best tacos and burritos in the Mission.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Carnitas

What do you love about this place?: One of the most unique vibes of any places in SF. Combo dive bar / white tablecloth italian restaurant (food is just so-so), ecletic live music every night, ecletic local crowd of regulars.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Dive bar stuff / basic food

What do you love about this place?: Great appetizers and entrees, good for large groups, not hard to get in
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Barg kebob, koobideh kebob

What do you love about this place?: Delicious small plates with a menu that changes often (and is always amazing). Cozy in the winter, sidewalk seating in the summer, not fussy! Also great for an event - did a birthday dinner here for 20 and it was so easy and perfect.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Sour cherry meatballs, batata harra. (Strangely, skip the charred eggplant)

What do you love about this place?: They have a set menu that is the best value in NYC. it‚Äôs like $60, you get a ton of dishes, and they‚Äôre all amazing. Cute little back garden in the summer. I always take out of town visitors here, and you can usually get in on pretty short notice.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Strawberry ribs, beignets, but really do the set menu and let them guide you

Restaurant Name: Istanbul Clinton Hill Mediterranean Gyro & Grill
What do you love about this place?: Family owned, friendly staff, generous portion sizes
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Chicken Adana Kebab

What do you love about this place?: Small, cozy, friendly neighborhood spot -- perfect for a chilly night
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Menu rotates but a constant is the lamb burger -- add the optional anchovies, trust me

What do you love about this place?: Love sitting at the long bar -- this place used to be trendier, but is still has great good & a great vibe IMO
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: I'm a sucker for Cacio e Pepe

What do you love about this place?: A very casual, very delicious, no frills spot
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: They probably have my most ordered burger in the city + their overripe plantains are the only ones that hold a candle to my mother's
How far in advance do we need to plan?: Pretty chill, lots of openings every day

What do you love about this place?: The BEST Yemeni in the city hands down. No frills, but their dishes are consistently excellent. Authentic, reasonably priced, and a great group trek so you can try all the great dishes
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Shafoot, muva fish, beef fahsa, lamb haneeth

What do you love about this place?: Kind of trendy but very worth it -- for the seafood & curry lovers
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Coconut Crab Curry is the must-do

What do you love about this place?: Calm, intimate setting with great aesthetic in the evenings. Date night friendly. Great customer service, yummy cocktails, and food doesn't disappoint
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Short Ribs Massaman Curry, Roasted Duck Buns

Cuisine Type: Breakfast Sandwiches, Sandwiches, Light Groceries, Dry Goods
What do you love about this place?: This place has some of the best sandwiches in the neighborhood, it's an every weekend staple for many of our crew in Bed-Stuy
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Bacon, Egg, & Cheese on Brioche; Turkey Club

What do you love about this place?: Great cafe to read, work, or for a friend catchup! Afrobeats always playing, friendly staff, and crepes are YUM!
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Prosciutto brie apple crepes

What do you love about this place?: Truly one of the friendliest places in NYC I've eaten -- the food is amazing & the staff has been so kind when I've gone
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Ka Praw Moo Krob -- delicious pork belly & rice

What do you love about this place?: Another most weekend staple -- the food here is bomb & cozy little backyard in the summer when weather is nice
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Breakfast burrito; chai latte

What do you love about this place?: Reliable fast casual spot that LOADS you up, has unlimited toppings, and excellent chicken shawarma. There are no vibes here, just a top notch neighborhood takeout place.
What are your "Must Have" recommendation: Chicken shawarma bowl
